title: Seriously?

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
Really? You actually expect me to believe that Kled has a defence power of **2**? (His secondary role is **TANK**)
Aurelion Sol has a defence power of 3 and he's totally defenceless as soon as some dust gets inside his stars... Yet Kled is somehow _more_ defenceless?

Kled starts the game with double anyones HP, gets 3000+ HP without building a single defensive Item, and gets skarl back, once (usually twice) a fight.

Yet Kled's defence power is less than Aurelion Sol's, and listed as the same as Karthus?
Ill tell you what, you show me a Karthus taking as many hits as a Kled before dying, and THEN ill believe your lies.


---------
_Seriously??_

replies.body: Everyone is trying to justify this when the logics just isn't there. Should honestly be 5 or higher. To be fair, he is weak when in his dismounted form and only option is to attempt to go ham to get his health back. But he definitely plays and has the resistances and health of an initiating tank.
The first sane words I've seen all day xD

Ya know it's debatable that Karthus has a safer laning phase since well he can farm passively and use a slow to escape and people with gap closers are subject to being killed by Karthus after death while also having a global ult that can do a significant amount of damage to every enemy who doesn't have invulnerability in their kits or {{item:3157}} .  You don't even have to kill your laning opponent to win it. 

Kled has to go ham in order to be used effectively,

Saftey and defence are different things, Caitlin, Ezreal and Jhin are 'Safe' Adc's they can farm and poke from range, (or escape easily if you're Ez) that doesn't give them more defence.

Karthus can choose to play passively, So can Azir, so can Taliyah, or Xerath, but they can also go ham and still win. 

Kled has to go ham its true, but its not like he cant ever get out again, he has a slow, 2 potential dashes (the first of which can be cast in any direction he wants), and a self-knockback. He has more escapes than Rammus, and rammus has maximum defence. (Rammus also is only effective if he goes ham)

Rammus has a high defensive stat because he is naturally a tank and Kled has no escapes once he has gone in which leaves him open to damage from everyone making his defense stat low but because he has the possibility of having say 8000+ health you have to shred can make him rather tanky. Also why was this entire post made to poke at riot for Kled's secondary role like get over it?
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

And no this post is not a poke at riot about Kleds secondary role, this is a poke about his defence rating.

never said i looked at it that way, but thats how riot's put it

I don't know how Riot determines those Stats but it feels like they looked at Kled's ridiculously low base health and based it off that. Why Skarl is ignored in that calculation, if there is one, is beyond me. Still, looking over the stats of a few champions makes it seem like the ratings are approximated in general so I'm not sure how seriously we're actually meant to take them at all. I mean, I've never used them but to a newer player they might _feel_ about right (might not, who am I to say).

Thing is, without his mount, Kled is fairly squishy, and in laning phase, you mostly only have the option to back to bring the mount back.

And even once you get tankier, he is still fairly squishy, simply because having 2 seperate health bars means, that the main one that means a lot can be taken down a lot quicker then you would think.

The amount of times i died while having the mounting animation going off was ludicrous when i was playing him.

Gnar is also fairly squishy without mega gnar... the thing is he DOES have access to mega gnar. 
Yea Kled is squishy without Skarl... but he DOES have access to skarl.

and so the champ as a whole is NOT squishy 

How does having more HP bars make his HP get taken down faster? as far as I'm aware, skarl has the same resistances as kled.

He even has untargetability.....

>Gnar is also fairly squishy without mega gnar... the thing is he DOES have access to mega gnar.

While this is a semi decent way to compare your not taking into account a few things.

1. Mini Gnar (the squishier of the two) is ranged, and thus can build his rage up at a safer distance to get to his tankier form, whereas Kled is always Melee, though you can get the Courage up with Kled's Q this is reliant on a bad opponent so not really reliable.
2. Gnar doesn't lose his ability to transform.
3. Skarl is the key part of Kled's kit, Kled is basically worthless without Skarl until you have some form of tank stats, because you will just get slaughtered, you are highly susceptible to kiting, and if your not going in, you are slow as fuck.
Gnar on the other hand is a really hard champion to kite, and can really just kite you.

1. Kled's auto attacks get longer range when he is dismounted (cos that makes sense?), they arent ranged but they can go over an entire minion wave still, plus he gets a selfknockback for escaping.
2. Gnar always loses the ability to transform, after he has recently turned back to mini gnar.
3. Skarl is a key part of Kled, yes. So why should we ignore Skarl's defences completely and give him only a 2 on the defence scale?

Kled has dashes, slows, gets tanky without building any tanky items. He has untergetability whenever he loses Skarl (and that untergatability breaks him out of any CC he happens to be in (RIP. WW, Malz, Galio, Lissandra, Morgana etc etc) 

and after all that you seriously trying to argue that he is more defenceless than Aurelion Sol? 
Just as vulnerable as Karthus.. (who's main job in a fight **IS TO DIE**.)
Because his whole kit is based around him going HAM in fights with full attack power that's why he was built upon a two health bar system to make sure he can hold his own when skaal runs off
